course_title: Leading and Managing the Future in Pharmacy Practice

learning_outcomes.description: Design and evaluate pharmacy services that address value-based care and organisational objectives.
Apply strategic planning principles to the development, resourcing, and implementation of pharmacy services within the healthcare system.

Develop and communicate a strategic business plan that aligns with healthcare priorities, demonstrates financial viability, and incorporates effective marketing strategies to engage stakeholders and support implementation.
Apply leadership and team management strategies to foster collaboration, and enhance workforce performance through recruitment, staff induction, and performance appraisal processes.
Analyse and address organisational challenges to change management to ensure the sustainability and impact of pharmacy services.

assessments.assessment_title: Business or Service Development Plan (Plan on 2 pages)
assessments.task_description:
• Outline the resourcing, activities, and outputs required to implement a new business initiative or pharmacy service for your professional practice setting, and the resulting desired outcomes and impact using a Logic Model (max. 2 x A4 pages, using at least 8-point font size).
  • See the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site for task details and the marking criteria.
  • This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) technologies, successful completion of the assessment will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which AI will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students may be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the Turnitin link provided on Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Tutorial assessments (Group presentations and Elevator Pitch)
assessments.due_date:
Group presentation Module-1 24/03/2026 - 24/03/2026

Elevator Pitch 27/04/2026 - 29/04/2026

Group presentation Module-3 26/05/2026 - 26/05/2026

Due on: Week 5 - Tutorial 1, Week 9 - Tutorial 2 and Week 13 for Tutorial 3
assessments.task_description:
There will be two parts associated with this assessment. This will include two group presentations (at Tutorial 1, and Tutorial 3) and an individual presentation of an elevator pitch of your business initiative at Tutorial 2. Details shown below:

Part 1- Group Presentations (Tutorial 1 and 3)

As a group you will prepare and present a presentation on a given task at the specified tutorials. The course coordinator will assess the presentations during online tutorials (T1 and T3). The coordinator and a guest will provide feedback on the presentations and there will be group discussion around learnings from each presentation. Two presenters per group per tutorial (group list in the Communications section). All group members MUST contribute to preparation of the materials for presentation and will receive the same marks if they have contributed meaningfully to the task. All group members should work collaboratively to respond to questions.

Upload slides for your presentation in your specified group discussion board (using slide deck/outlook). Ensure the group signs the declaration (see attached) regarding the contributions of each group member.

Length: Maximum 6 minutes

Submission: Upload to your group Discussion Board via Learn.UQ. Present your group work at your tutorial and receive feedback and questions from other groups, and course coordinator

Deadline: Upload slides to your group Discussion Board on the morning of the Module 1 and Module 3 tutorials

Weight: 5% for each group presentation

See Learn.UQ for details of the group tutorial presentations


Part 2- Individual Elevator Pitch (Tutorial 2)

For this assessment, you will develop a concise and persuasive elevator pitch outlining your business initiative or pharmacy service. The purpose of this task is to convince a key stakeholder of the value and impact of your proposal within a limited timeframe. This tutorial and all elevator pitch presentations will be recorded for review and marking purposes.

Key Requirements

  • Length: Between 4 to 5 minutes (the assessor will stop marking after 5 minutes - i.e. maximum 5 minutes).
  • Submission: Present your pitch at your allocated online tutorial and receive feedback from your peers, course coordinator and expert guest (a pharmacy leader).
  • Deadline: Module 2 Tutorial.
  • Weighting: 20% of your final grade.
  • Technical Considerations: Ensure clear audio, and students must have their camera on along with the slides to ensure it is clear that you are presenting the work and responding to questions (for verification of identity).


Task Instructions

Your elevator pitch should: explain your proposed initiative or pharmacy service, to convince the listener of why your initiative or service would be productive/beneficial to implement/support in your professional practice setting.

  1. Introduction: Provide a very brief introduction of yourself and your professional role.
  2. Business Initiative or Service Proposal: Clearly describe your proposed initiative or service.
  3. Problem Statement & Justification: Identify the problem your initiative addresses and its purpose. Justify why this initiative is needed within your professional setting.
  4. Potential Impact: Explain how your initiative will benefit stakeholders and contribute to the healthcare system.
  5. Call to Action: Conclude with a clear and actionable request (e.g., funding, support, policy change).
  6. Evaluation: How will you evaluate the new service model if it is implemented?


There is no strict sequence for presenting these elements, but your pitch should be engaging, structured, and compelling.

  • See the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site for details and the marking criteria.


Use of AI and Machine Translation Technologies:

These tasks have been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) technologies, successful completion of the assessment will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which AI will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students may be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
